question: Which island houses the "Simpson Bay Lagoon"?
explanation: Simpson Bay Lagoon is one of the largest inland lagoons in the West Indies region of the Caribbean Sea. It is located on the island of Saint Martin. The border between the French and Dutch halves of the island runs across the center of the lagoon. Mullet Pond is a section of the Simpson Bay Lagoon which still contains a substantial portion of the Red Mangroves. It has been a protected Ramsar Site.
